AI in Chess

Chess Info

About Me

Introduction

Topic: Chess

The usage of AI for chess in general is high. In chess, people use AI to analyze games, study theory, and to practice certain positions. Some people also use AI to cheat in chess.

History

First Usage

Alan Turing first developed a program on paper that could play a full chess game in 1951. In 1997, World Chess Champion Garry Kasparov lost to IBM's Deep Blue in a 6-game chess match, the first time a chess AI beat a grandmaster in a match.

Deep Blue

Image Credit: IBM

Most Important Use

Chess AI is used by serious chess players to analyze their games and their opponents’ games. This provides insights, helps the players learn from their mistakes, and improve their skills.

Stockfish Chess Engine

Image Credit: chess.com

Overview of Current uses

Top chess players use AI to study opening theory and analyze games. AI is also used to practice tactics, opening, middlegame, and endgame positions. Finally, AI is also used by some people to cheat in their games.
